Name: 1.5°C National Pathway Explorer
Description: This tool shows how a selection of 64 countries across all regions and the development spectrum can align their decarbonisation trajectories with the Paris Agreement.
Geographies Included: Bangladesh China India Japan Malaysia Myanmar Nepal New Zeland Pakistan Philippines Singapore South Korea Thailand Viet Nam Indonesia Argentina Chile Columbia Costa Rica Ecuador Mexico Peru Botswana Cameroon Democratic Republic of the Congo Egypt Ethiopia Kenya Morocco Mozambique Nigeria Saudi Arabia Senegal South Africa Tanzania United Arab Emirates Zimbabwe Canada United States European Union France Germany Norway Poland Switzerland Turkey United Kingdom Russia Ukraine
Target audience: Government ministries, Advocacy organizations/NGOs, General Public

Name: Adaptation Map
Description: Overview of adaptation actions that have been taken by 11 countries in West Africa and the Member States of the Caribbean Community since 2010.
Geographies Included: Antigua and Barbuda Benin Burkina Faso Bahamas Belize Barbados Dominica Guinea Gambia Guinea-Bissau Grenada Guyana Haiti Jamaica Saint Kitts and Nevis Liberia Saint Lucia Mali Montserrat Niger Regional Senegal Sierra Leone Suriname Togo Trinidad and Tobago Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
Target audience: Government ministries, Advocacy organizations/NGOs, General Public

Name: Adaptation Fund
Description: The Adaptation Fund finances projects and programmes that help vulnerable communities in developing countries adapt to climate change.
Target audience: Government ministries, Cities, Investors, Advocacy organizations/NGOs

Name: C-ROADS
Description: C-ROADS helps people understand the long-term climate impacts of national and regional greenhouse gas emission reductions at the global level.
Target audience: Government ministries, Advocacy organizations/NGOs, General public, Cities, Corporate, Media/journalists, Investors

Name: Climate Action Tracker
Organization: Climate Analytics, NewClimate Institute, Institute for Essential Services Reform (IESR), The Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research (PIK)
Description: The Climate Action Tracker (CAT) tracks progress towards the globally agreed aim of holding warming well below 2°C and efforts to limit warming to 1.5°C.
Geographies Included: Islamic Republic of Iran Russian Federation Singapore Thailand Turkey Viet Nam Argentina Canada China Colombia Egypt India Indonesia Mexico New Zealand Saudi Arabia South Korea United Arab Emirates Australia Brazil Chile European Union Germany Japan Kazakhstan Peru South Africa Switzerland United States Costa Rica Ethiopia Kenya Morocco Nepal Nigeria Norway The Gambia United Kingdom
Visualization type: Interactive Charts, Interactive Maps, Report, Raw Data
Target audience: Government ministries

Name: ND-GAIN
Description: ND-GAIN’s tool measures 181 countries on their climate risk and readiness to successfully adapt.
Visualization type: Interactive Charts, Interactive Maps, Raw Data, Report
Target audience: Government ministries, Academic, Cities, Corporate, Media/journalists, Advocacy organizations/NGOs, Investors, General Public

Name: UNEP Pledge Pipeline
Description: The UNEP Pledge Pipeline tracks GHG emissions reductions pledged by each countries' Nationally Determined Contributions (INDCs/NDCs) that are submitted to the UNFCCC.
Target audience: Government ministries

Name: Science Based Targets Initiative (SBTi) Progress Data Dashboard
Description: The Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) provides the knowledge necessary to enable organizations to set science-based emissions reduction targets.
Target audience: Corporate

Name: Cal-Adapt
Organization: Geospatial Innovation Facility (GIF), California Energy Commission (CEC)
Description: Cal-Adapt provides a way to explore peer-reviewed data that portrays how climate change might affect California at the state and local level.
Visualization type: Interactive Charts, Interactive Maps, Raw Data
Target audience: Government ministries, Cities, Corporate, Advocacy organizations/NGOs, Academic, General public

Name: ClimateWorks Tracker
Description: The Carbon Tracker dashboard enables users to track the decarbonization progress  of the major emitters over time.
Geographies Included: United States, Mexico, European Union, China, India
Visualization type: Interactive Charts, Interactive Maps, Raw Data
Target audience: Government ministries, Cities, Corporate, Investors, Academic, General public

Name: Climate Chance Cartography
Description: Tracker for all the climate initiatives carried out at the global level by non-state actors, identified by Climate Chance.
Target audience: Advocacy organizations/NGOs, General public

Name: CEOS GST Portal
Description: A collection of datasets, resources, and guidance to support the Global Stocktake process of the Paris Climate Agreement.
Target audience: Government ministries

Name: Climate Change Laws of the World
Organization: Grantham Research Institute on Climate Change and the Environment, Sabin Center for Climate Change Law
Description: This database covers climate and related laws and laws and policies that promote low carbon transitions relevant to areas like energy, transport, land use, and climate resilience.

Name: Climate Change Performance Index (CCPI)
Organization: Germanwatch, NewClimate Institute, Climate Action Network (CAN)
Description: The CCPI tracks 60 countries and the EU's climate action performance by modeling GHG emmissions, energy use, and climate policy efforts.
Target audience: Academic, Government ministries, General public

Name: RegioClim
Description: Tool used to facilitate the access to state of the art regional climate projections by constraining the information to some basic graphics that can easily be interpreted and reused for reports involving climate change.
Geographies Included: Central African Republic Angola Burundi Benin Burkina Faso Botswana Côte d'Ivoire Cameroon Congo, The Democratic Republic of the Congo Comoros Cabo Verde Diibouti Algeria Egypt Eritrea Western Sahara Ethiopia Gabon Ghana Guinea Gambia Guinea-Bissau Equatorial Guinea Kenya Liberia, Lesotho, Morocco Madagascar Mali Mozambique Mauritania Mauritius Malawi Namibia Niger Nigeria Rwanda Sudan Senegal Sierra Leone Somalia South Sudan Sao Tome and Principe Swaziland Seychelles Chad Togo Tunisia Tanzania, United Republic of Uganda South Africa Zambia Zimbabwe
Target audience: Government ministries, Corporate, Advocacy organizations/NGOs, General public

Name: Climate Central
Description: Climate Central uses science, big data, and technology to generate local storylines and compelling visuals that make climate change personal and show what can be done about it.

Name: Climate Impact Lab
Organization: Rhodium Group, University of California, Berkeley, Energy Policy Institute (EPIC) at the University of Chicago, Rutgers University.

Name: CDP Open Data Portal

Name: Climate Equity Reference Calculator

Name: IRENA

Organization: International Institue for Applied Systems Analysis

Name: Paris Equity Check
Organization: Climate Energy College, University of Melbourne
Description: Maps showing countries pledges and the effect of their pledge on global warming

Name: PBL Climate Pledge Tool
Description: This tool shows the targets in these Nationally Determined Contributions and pledges made earlier for 2020. This tool compares targets for the 26 emitting parties with greenhouse gas emission projections up to 2030

Target audience: General Public

Name: PBL Global Stocktake Tool
Description: The Global Stocktake tool presents several indicators to track progress in implementing the Paris Climate Agreement.The indicators presented here are based on model-based scenarios that compare the action needed to meet the overall objectives, with the action promised by individual countries (reported via the Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC) and the actual implemented policies (based on a database of currently implemented policies). The stocktake tool intends to allow a wide range of interested parties to assess progress.
Target audience: Government ministries, General Public, Advocacy Organizations

Name: Paris Reality Check
Organization: Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research (PIK)
Description: This site lists various tools and datasets that allow you to see things like emissions data, impacts on coral/sea-level, equity assessments. ETC

Target audience: Government ministries, general Public, Advocacy Organizations

Name: Regulatory Indicators for Sustainable Energy (RISE)
Description:
A set of indicators to help compare national policy and regulatory frameworks for sustainable energy. . It assesses countries’ policy and regulatory support for each of the 
four pillars of sustainable energy—access to electricity, access to 
clean cooking (for 55 access-deficit countries), energy efficiency, and 
renewable energy.
Visualization type: Interactive Maps, Interactive Charts, Raw Data, Resource Aggregation
Target audience: Government ministries, Cities, Corporate, Media/journalists, Advocacy organizations/NGOs, Investors, Academic, General public

Name: PREPdata

Name: Global Calculator
Organization: Department for Business, Energy, and Industrial Strategy UK

Name: UNFCCC Climate Finance Data Portal
Organization: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

Name: Voluntary REDD Database
Description: It aimed to improve transparency around REDD+ and support efforts to identify and analyse gaps and overlaps in REDD+ financing. The VRD is a key provider of information to the global community on REDD+ financing, actions and results, providing the ability to search and summarise data that is submitted and updated throughout the year by Partner countries and stakeholder institutions.

Name: Emissions Gap Report

Name: State of Climate Action toward 2030 and 2050
